thread.title: Kanye West promotes Yeezy Money Solana cryptocurrency on X sparking skepticism over legitimacy
thread.title_full: Kanye West promotes Yeezy Money Solana cryptocurrency on X sparking skepticism over legitimacy

author: Pop Culture & Art
title: Kanye West promotes Yeezy Money Solana cryptocurrency on X sparking skepticism over legitimacy
text:
U.S. rapper and entrepreneur Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, appears to have launched his own cryptocurrency, a Solana-based token called Yeezy Money (YZY).
Ye, formerly known has Kanye West, has announced that people can now purchase items from his YEEZY shop using crypto ðŸ‘€
â€” ryan ðŸ¤¿ (@scubaryan_)[pic.twitter.com/3SfnMXMneL][August 20, 2025]
In a post shared Wednesday on his official X account, West wrote, â€œYeezy Money is here â€¦ A new economy, built on chain,â€ alongside what appeared to be a wallet address and a link to a trading platform. According to data from the analytics site GMGN.Ai, YZYâ€™s market capitalization is currently valued at around $2 billion.
The website linked in the post describes YZY as a project designed to give users control â€œfree from centralized authority.â€ It highlights a wider ecosystem including Ye Payâ€”a payment processor promising lower fees for merchantsâ€”as well as a planned YZY credit card. However, the site also discloses that the token is intended only as a symbolic expression of support and not as an investment opportunity.
The announcement has sparked skepticism online, with many X users speculating that Westâ€™s account may have been hacked. Those doubts are partly fueled by Westâ€™s previous comments in February, when he criticized memecoins as schemes that â€œprey on the fans with hypeâ€ and denied plans to launch his own cryptocurrency. At the time, he claimed he was offered $2 million to promote a fraudulent token but refused.
Despite the suspicions, Westâ€™s official website and online store list YZY as a potential payment option, lending weight to the possibility that the project is genuine.
If confirmed, the move would represent a sharp pivot in Westâ€™s stance on digital assets.
